timeline.bodyText: What if the method is not one of these types? It can be an intermediate ForgedMethod or an existing HelperMethod that we have created. Why shouldn't we reuse that one?
timeline.author: filiphr

replies.bodyText: is not possible here.. We don't resolve forged methods.. If so, we should throw an unsupported.

timeline.bodyText:
Why is this change needed?
ySourceType and targetTypeX don't have to be the same types I think. One can be more specific then the other.
timeline.author: filiphr

replies.bodyText: the change was forgotten last time.. it's actually a bug.
replies.author: sjaakd

timeline.bodyText: Perhaps this should be named resolveViaGivenMethod? Or something in that direction. applyMatching differs from the other methods in my opinion
